Sentencas: The development of carbon-and sulfur-tolerant anode materials is highly desirable for the commercial application of solid-oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Pd-impregnated Sr1.9VMoO6-δ double perovskite as an efficient and stable anode for solid-oxide fuel cells operating on sulfur-containing syngas

Sentencas: We report herein the performance of Sr1.9VMoO6-delta (SVMO) double perovskite as a potential anode material for SOFCs and the improvement of its electrochemical performance on hydrogen and H2S-containing syngas operation.
Titulo: Pd-impregnated Sr1.9VMoO6-δ double perovskite as an efficient and stable anode for solid-oxide fuel cells operating on sulfur-containing syngas

Sentencas: SVMO has a cubic structure and thermal expansion coefficient of 13.3 x 10(-6) K-1 between 30 and 1000 degrees C in 5% H-2/Ar.
Titulo: Pd-impregnated Sr1.9VMoO6-δ double perovskite as an efficient and stable anode for solid-oxide fuel cells operating on sulfur-containing syngas

Sentencas: The electrical conductivities of SVMO in H-2 are considerably higher than those of existing double-perovskite anodes and traditional Ni-YSZ (40 vol% Ni) anode.
Titulo: Pd-impregnated Sr1.9VMoO6-δ double perovskite as an efficient and stable anode for solid-oxide fuel cells operating on sulfur-containing syngas

Sentencas: The impregnation of Pd nanoparticles to form a composite anode (Pd-SVMO) or the addition of a Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 buffer layer between anode and electrolyte significantly improves the electrochemical performance of SVMO for hydrogen oxidation, and the former is considerably more effective than the latter.
Titulo: Pd-impregnated Sr1.9VMoO6-δ double perovskite as an efficient and stable anode for solid-oxide fuel cells operating on sulfur-containing syngas

Sentencas: The Pd-SVMO composite anode exhibits good stability and resistance to carbon deposition and sulfur poisoning for an SOFC operated on H2S-containing syngas based on an 80 h test, suggesting the potential of this anode material for SOFCs running on hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Pd-impregnated Sr1.9VMoO6-δ double perovskite as an efficient and stable anode for solid-oxide fuel cells operating on sulfur-containing syngas

Sentencas: The mechanisms for improving the electrochemical performance of the anodes and the resistance to carbon deposition and sulfur poisoning are also discussed.
Titulo: Pd-impregnated Sr1.9VMoO6-δ double perovskite as an efficient and stable anode for solid-oxide fuel cells operating on sulfur-containing syngas
